definition: family of a functionary (i.e. educated middle class in Qing times)

sentences.english: Historically, the elite government officials are generally people with bound volumes of the family tree.
sentences.chinese: 歷史上，官宦人家一般都是採用裝訂成冊的家譜。

sentences.english: Dumu was born in a strongly culture-flavored family which had produced generations of government officials.
sentences.chinese: 杜牧出身於一個世代官宦並具有濃厚文化氣氛的家庭。

sentences.english: Especially in Ming and Qing dynasties, quite a few government officers constructed their luxurious houses here.
sentences.chinese: 特別是在明清兩個朝代，許多官宦在此興建園舍。

sentences.english: Junior officials or ordinary people were not allowed to use them.
sentences.chinese: 一般官宦以及平民百姓是不準用的。

definition: family of a functionary (i.e. educated middle class in Qing times)
offspring a famous family (idiom); good breeding/blue blood
rich and powerful/rich and influential person/big shot
the emperor relatives (idiom); person with powerful connections
high official and noble persons (idiom); the great and the good
land-owning class, esp. during Wei, Jin and North-South dynasties 魏晉南北朝|魏晋南北朝
family with a literary reputation (idiom); literary family
a scholar or government official living in one's village/a village gentleman/squire
